Item 1. Business.summary:
Here are the key facts from PART I - Item 1. Business section in bullet points:

• As of January 31, 2025, more than 19,650 customers across nearly every industry used Okta's solutions to secure and manage identities around the world.
• The company has over 7,000 integrations with cloud, mobile, and web applications and IT infrastructure providers as of January 31, 2025.
• Okta employs a SaaS business model and generates revenue primarily by selling multi-year subscriptions to its cloud-based offerings.

Item 1A. Risk Factors.summary:
Here are the key facts from OKTA's PART I - Item 1A. Risk Factors section in bullet points:

• Adverse general economic, market, and industry conditions have reduced demand for OKTA's solutions in the past, which could harm revenue, results of operations, and cash flows.
• OKTA has experienced rapid growth in prior periods, but failure to effectively manage future growth could harm the business and future prospects.
• The company faces intense competition from larger, well-established companies, and may lack sufficient financial or other resources to maintain or improve its competitive position.
• OKTA has a history of losses and may not be consistently profitable in the future.
• Customer retention is crucial for OKTA's business, as failure to retain existing customers could harm revenues and results of operations.
• Quarterly fluctuations in results of operations can occur due to various factors making future results difficult to predict.
• Interruptions or performance problems with technology, systems, or infrastructure can result in delays in platform deployment.
• OKTA has experienced cybersecurity incidents in the past that harmed reputation, created additional liability, and adversely impacted financial results.
• The company may experience similar incidents in the future, including disabling access to its service.
• Failure to comply with privacy or security provisions of OKTA's policies, contracts, and legal/ regulatory requirements can result in proceedings, actions, or penalties against the company.

Item 1C. Cybersecurity.summary:
Here are the key facts from PART I - Item 1C. Cybersecurity section in bullet points:

• Okta, Inc. is subject to a wide variety of cybersecurity attacks on its systems, networks, and data on an ongoing basis with increasing sophistication.

• The company has an established cybersecurity risk management program intended to protect its critical systems, internal networks, and information.

• The board of directors has delegated oversight responsibility of the cybersecurity risk management program to the cybersecurity risk committee.

• Okta, Inc. devotes significant resources to create security measures, configuration policies, and response plans to address cybersecurity threats.

• The company cannot eliminate all risks related to cybersecurity threats or incidents, despite its efforts to implement a robust cybersecurity risk management program.

• Okta's cybersecurity strategy is to develop a consistent framework of security controls that can apply to all business functions.

• The company designs and assesses its cybersecurity risk management program against the National Institute of Standards and Technology Cybersecurity Framework (NIST Framework).

• Certain Okta Platform product offerings have attained multiple security certifications, including details described in "Our Technology" under Part I, Item I of this Annual Report on Form 10-K.

Note: The total word count is within the 200-word limit.

Item 2. Properties.summary:
Here are the key facts extracted from PART I - Item 2. Properties section in bullet points:

• Our corporate headquarters is located in San Francisco, California.
• We lease approximately 285,996 square feet under a lease that expires in October 2028.
• We have two five-year options to extend this lease, subject to certain requirements.
• We sublease approximately 111,168 square feet of space under this lease to third parties.

Item 5. Market for Registrant's Common E.summary:
Here are the key facts extracted from PART II - Item 5. Market for Registrant's Common Equity, Related Stockholder Matters and Issuer Purchases of Equity Securities in bullet points:

• Our Class A common stock has been listed on the Nasdaq Global Select Market under the symbol "OKTA" since April 7, 2017.
• As of February 27, 2025, we had 56 holders of record of our Class A common stock and 15 holders of record of our Class B common stock.
• The actual number of Class A beneficial stockholders is substantially greater than the number of holders of record due to a large portion being held in street name by brokers and other nominees.
• We have never declared or paid cash dividends on our capital stock, and currently intend to retain any future earnings for business operation purposes.
• Our board of directors will determine whether to pay dividends on our capital stock based on financial condition, results of operations, capital requirements, general business conditions, and other factors.

Item 7. MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANAL.summary:
Here are the key facts from the MANAGEMENT'S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS section in bullet points:

• As of January 31, 2025, more than 19,650 customers across nearly every industry used our solutions to secure and manage identities around the world.

• Our customers consist of leading global organizations ranging from the largest enterprises, to small and medium-sized businesses, universities, non-profits, and government agencies.

• As of January 31, 2025, we had over 7,000 integrations with cloud, mobile, web applications, IT infrastructure, and security vendors through our Okta Integration Network.

• We employ a SaaS business model and generate revenue primarily by selling multi-year subscriptions to our cloud-based offerings.

• Our subscription fees include the use of our platforms to securely connect people to technologies and services at the right time.

Item 7A. Quantitative and Qualitative Di.summary:
Here are the key facts extracted from PART II - Item 7A. Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures about Market Risk in bullet points:

• As of January 31, 2025, our cash, cash equivalents, and short-term investments totaled $2,523 million.
• $2,362 million of these were invested in U.S. treasury securities, money market funds, corporate debt securities, and certificates of deposit.
• Our cash and cash equivalents are held for working capital and general corporate purposes, including potential future acquisition activity.
• A hypothetical 10% change in foreign currency exchange rates applicable to our business during fiscal 2025, 2024, and 2023 would not have had a material impact on our consolidated financial statements.
• As of January 31, 2025, $510 million principal amount of the 2025 Notes remain outstanding, classified as current liabilities due to their upcoming maturity on September 1, 2025.
• A hypothetical 10% relative change in interest rates would not have had a material impact on the value of our cash equivalents or investment portfolio as of January 31, 2025.

Item 8. FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND SUPPLEM.summary:
Here are the key facts extracted from the PART II - Item 8. FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND SUPPLEMENTARY DATA section in bullet points:

• The auditor, Ernst & Young LLP, has served as Okta's auditor since 2013.
• The auditor expressed an unqualified opinion on Okta's consolidated financial statements for the three years ended January 31, 2025.
• The auditor also expressed an unqualified opinion on Okta's internal control over financial reporting as of January 31, 2025.
• The auditor conducted their audits in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (PCAOB).
• The auditor performed procedures to assess the risks of material misstatement of the financial statements and evaluated the accounting principles used by management.

Item 9A. Controls and Procedures.summary:
Here are the key facts from PART II - Item 9A. Controls and Procedures section of OKTA's Annual Report on Form 10-K, formatted as bullet points:

• As of January 31, 2025, OKTA's management concluded that its disclosure controls and procedures were effective to provide reasonable assurance that information required to be disclosed in reports filed under the Exchange Act was recorded, processed, summarized, and reported within specified time periods.

• OKTA's internal control over financial reporting was effective as of January 31, 2025, based on an evaluation conducted by management using the 2013 framework issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission.

• There were no changes in internal control over financial reporting identified during the quarter ended January 31, 2025 that have materially affected or are reasonably likely to materially affect OKTA's internal control over financial reporting.

• Management recognizes inherent limitations on the effectiveness of controls and procedures, including resource constraints and the need for judgment in evaluating the benefits of possible controls relative to their costs.

Item 9B. Other Information.summary:
Here are the key facts extracted from PART II - Item 9B. Other Information section:

• None of OKTA's directors or officers informed the company about the adoption or termination of a "Rule 10b5-1 trading arrangement" during the quarter ended January 31, 2025.

Note: There is only one fact provided in this section. If more information is available, I can try to extract additional key facts.

Item 10. Directors, Executive Officers a.summary:
Here are the key facts extracted from PART III - Item 10. Directors, Executive Officers and Corporate Governance in bullet points:

• The Proxy Statement relating to OKTA's 2025 Annual Meeting of Stockholders will be filed with the SEC within 120 days of the fiscal year ended January 31, 2025.
• OKTA's board of directors has adopted a code of conduct that applies to all employees, officers, and directors.
• The full text of OKTA's code of conduct is available on its investor relations website at investor.okta.com under "Responsibility and Governance."
• OKTA intends to post information regarding amendments or waivers of the code of conduct on its website.

Item 15. Exhibits and Financial Statemen.summary:
Here are the key facts extracted from PART IV - Item 15. Exhibits and Financial Statement Schedules in bullet points:

• The company has filed the following documents as part of this report: 
  • Financial Statements
  • Financial Statement Schedules (except for those not required, applicable, or included elsewhere)

• The Index to Financial Statements is located under Part II, Item 8 of this Annual Report on Form 10-K.

• The Exhibit Index can be found immediately following the signature page of this Annual Report on Form 10-K.
